title:SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide - Ash and Iron
description:https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c/edit?usp=sharing

// Forced Memorializer (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvE / God-PvE): "At first glance this is a precision scout rifle so it would be easy to write it off as dead on arrival, however the addition of some new perks - notably Bewildering Burst - gives this gun some much needed utility that could actually push this into relevance. Outside of that this straight up powercreeps Hung Jury as well. Ancillary Ordinance is actually pretty strong as well." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,god-pve
dimwishlist:item=1197073834&perks=1840239774,3230963543,2289534249,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=1197073834&perks=1840239774,3230963543,2289534249,1202584452

// Forced Memorializer (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvE): "At first glance this is a precision scout rifle so it would be easy to write it off as dead on arrival, however the addition of some new perks - notably Bewildering Burst - gives this gun some much needed utility that could actually push this into relevance. Outside of that this straight up powercreeps Hung Jury as well. Ancillary Ordinance is actually pretty strong as well." Recommended MW: Reload, Handling.|tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=1197073834&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3700496672,3891536761

// Seraphine Haze (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvE): "One of the worst elements of one of the worst archetypes of the worst weapon family is not a good place to start out. There are some interesting new perks but the base gun they're attached to is too heavy to be carried. And the ammo gen stat here is bad." Recommended MW: Reload, Range.|tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=1524387902&perks=1840239774,3230963543,1955165503,2922950962

// Drang (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvE / God-PvE): "It's back and it's pretty decent. This gun has never been a good pairing with Sturm, and it still isn't. Even with Disruption Break in the first column it still doesn't justify running double primary. Sidearms are the highest damage weapon family in the game, so Sturm will kind of always play second fiddle to this anyway. As a standalone weapon though this is totally legitimate - albeit not very unique." Recommended MW: Reload, Range.|tags:pve,god-pve
dimwishlist:item=358190158&perks=3250034553,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123

// Drang (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvE): "It's back and it's pretty decent. This gun has never been a good pairing with Sturm, and it still isn't. Even with Disruption Break in the first column it still doesn't justify running double primary. Sidearms are the highest damage weapon family in the game, so Sturm will kind of always play second fiddle to this anyway. As a standalone weapon though this is totally legitimate - albeit not very unique." Recommended MW: Reload, Range, Handling.|tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=358190158&perks=3250034553,3230963543,3017780555,3081867624

// Drang (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvP / God-PvP): "It's back and it's pretty decent. This gun has never been a good pairing with Sturm, and it still isn't. Even with Disruption Break in the first column it still doesn't justify running double primary. Sidearms are the highest damage weapon family in the game, so Sturm will kind of always play second fiddle to this anyway. As a standalone weapon though this is totally legitimate - albeit not very unique." Recommended MW: Range, Handling.|tags:pvp,god-pvp
dimwishlist:item=358190158&perks=3250034553,3142289711,588594999,699525795

// Drang (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvP): "It's back and it's pretty decent. This gun has never been a good pairing with Sturm, and it still isn't. Even with Disruption Break in the first column it still doesn't justify running double primary. Sidearms are the highest damage weapon family in the game, so Sturm will kind of always play second fiddle to this anyway. As a standalone weapon though this is totally legitimate - albeit not very unique." Recommended MW: Range, Handling.|tags:pvp
dimwishlist:item=358190158&perks=3250034553,3142289711,588594999,3081867624

// MIDA Mini-Tool (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvE / God-PvE): "One of the best elements of the best archetype of this weapon family is a good place to start. That being said this is basically just a sidegrade from Yeartide Apex released earlier this same season. The synergy this shares with MIDA Multi-Tool doesn't really matter since you wouldn't run two primaries anyway and the MIDA Multi-Tool rework looks pretty terrible in PvE regardless." Recommended MW: Reload, Range.|tags:pve,god-pve
dimwishlist:item=3946054154&perks=3250034553,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3946054154&perks=3250034553,3230963543,3017780555,2890807135
dimwishlist:item=3946054154&perks=3250034553,3230963543,243981275,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3946054154&perks=3250034553,3230963543,243981275,2890807135
dimwishlist:item=3946054154&perks=3250034553,679225683,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3946054154&perks=3250034553,679225683,3017780555,2890807135
dimwishlist:item=3946054154&perks=3250034553,679225683,243981275,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3946054154&perks=3250034553,679225683,243981275,2890807135

// MIDA Mini-Tool (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvE): "One of the best elements of the best archetype of this weapon family is a good place to start. That being said this is basically just a sidegrade from Yeartide Apex released earlier this same season. The synergy this shares with MIDA Multi-Tool doesn't really matter since you wouldn't run two primaries anyway and the MIDA Multi-Tool rework looks pretty terrible in PvE regardless." Recommended MW: Reload, Range.|tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=3946054154&perks=3250034553,3230963543,3017780555,3081867624

// Submersion (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvE / God-PvE): "Very unique and interesting weapon. The actual configuration of the gun is pretty random, and mostly determined by the Bolts column. You can make it deal explosive damage to help with add clear, have the bolt itself deal extra damage, have it apply a damage-over-time effect, to name a few. The Rail column mostly just gives nice stats, including the new persistence stat that determines how long the bolts last in the environment before expiring. Unfortunately in the case of the DoT effect from Charged Bolts the Persistence stat does not benefit like it should. Also, bolts can be collected after shooting them (and in the case of Serrated Bolts deals damage when you remove them from an enemy), which means this is a legendary heavy weapon with technically infinite ammo! Aggregate Charge is an interesting damage perk." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,god-pve
dimwishlist:item=3524386983&perks=4088731040,2955427634,951095735,3764420437
dimwishlist:item=3524386983&perks=4088731040,2955427634,951095735,2978966579
dimwishlist:item=3524386983&perks=4088731040,2955427634,3300816228,3764420437
dimwishlist:item=3524386983&perks=4088731040,2955427634,3300816228,2978966579

// Submersion (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvE / God-PvE): "Very unique and interesting weapon. The actual configuration of the gun is pretty random, and mostly determined by the Bolts column. You can make it deal explosive damage to help with add clear, have the bolt itself deal extra damage, have it apply a damage-over-time effect, to name a few. The Rail column mostly just gives nice stats, including the new persistence stat that determines how long the bolts last in the environment before expiring. Unfortunately in the case of the DoT effect from Charged Bolts the Persistence stat does not benefit like it should. Also, bolts can be collected after shooting them (and in the case of Serrated Bolts deals damage when you remove them from an enemy), which means this is a legendary heavy weapon with technically infinite ammo! Aggregate Charge is an interesting damage perk." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,god-pve
dimwishlist:item=1724104236&perks=4088731040,2955427634,951095735,3764420437
dimwishlist:item=1724104236&perks=4088731040,2955427634,951095735,2978966579
dimwishlist:item=1724104236&perks=4088731040,2955427634,3300816228,3764420437
dimwishlist:item=1724104236&perks=4088731040,2955427634,3300816228,2978966579

// Submersion (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvE): "Very unique and interesting weapon. The actual configuration of the gun is pretty random, and mostly determined by the Bolts column. You can make it deal explosive damage to help with add clear, have the bolt itself deal extra damage, have it apply a damage-over-time effect, to name a few. The Rail column mostly just gives nice stats, including the new persistence stat that determines how long the bolts last in the environment before expiring. Unfortunately in the case of the DoT effect from Charged Bolts the Persistence stat does not benefit like it should. Also, bolts can be collected after shooting them (and in the case of Serrated Bolts deals damage when you remove them from an enemy), which means this is a legendary heavy weapon with technically infinite ammo! Aggregate Charge is an interesting damage perk." Recommended MW: Reload, Persistence, Velocity.|tags:pve

// Submersion (Season 27)
//notes:SpaceMonkey (PvE): "Very unique and interesting weapon. The actual configuration of the gun is pretty random, and mostly determined by the Bolts column. You can make it deal explosive damage to help with add clear, have the bolt itself deal extra damage, have it apply a damage-over-time effect, to name a few. The Rail column mostly just gives nice stats, including the new persistence stat that determines how long the bolts last in the environment before expiring. Unfortunately in the case of the DoT effect from Charged Bolts the Persistence stat does not benefit like it should. Also, bolts can be collected after shooting them (and in the case of Serrated Bolts deals damage when you remove them from an enemy), which means this is a legendary heavy weapon with technically infinite ammo! Aggregate Charge is an interesting damage perk." Recommended MW: Reload, Persistence, Velocity.|tags:pve
